div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1063 Olbia (mod. Parutino), Ochakov raion, Nikolaev oblast, Ukraine, 1946 Burial: late 4th-early 3rd cent. B.C. Contents: 53 AE. On floor of one room in agora; aes grave and 5 fish-shaped coins in ancient pit Olbia: 21 fish-shaped AE, (anepigraphic [19]; as AMNG I.1, pl. 8, 6 [2]) 1 aes grave (as Burachkov, pl. 1, 8) 27 AE (as AMNG I.1, pl. 9, 8 [2], 10-11 [6], 13 [11], 16 [1], 22 [2], 23 [5]) Panticapaeum: 1 AE (as BMC 17) Unc.: 3 AE Disposition: Kiev Kbarko, "Ol'viia," pp. 351-2, nos. 171-209 (with omissions and inaccurate descriptions)
